data.content:
Okay, I need to create a detailed directory of antique appraisers in Phoenix, Arizona based on the provided search results. Let me start by understanding what the user is asking for. They want an overview of services, a list of appraisers with specific details, service areas and pricing, and contact info/business hours. First, looking at the search results. The main sources here are from Prestige Estate Services (results 1-3, 6-8), which have multiple appraisers listed like Edward Kitson, Elizabeth Lovett, Stephanie Calman, Erika Holycross, Alicia Weaver. There's also Precious Metals Refinery (result 4) which does jewelry appraisals but mentions Tucson; maybe they serve Phoenix? Then Asian Antique Appraisers (result7) but their website is asianantiqueappraisers.comâ€”not sure if they operate in Phoenix. Result5 talks about rug appraisals but Ellen Amirkhan is in Dallas. Result9 and10 are about home appraisals which might not be relevant here. So focusing on Prestige Estate Services first since they have a Phoenix location mentioned in result1. Their team includes several appraisers: Edward Kitson, Elizabeth Lovett Stephanie Calman from result1; Erika Holycross (result3), Alicia Weaver (result8). Each has different specialties. Result6 mentions their antique appraisal services specifically: furniture appraisal including age patina assessment etc., so that's part of specialties. Contact info for Prestige is from result1: phone number 1-844-ITEM-VAL and email Appraisal@PrestigeEstateServices.com. Business hours aren't listed explicitly but probably standard unless noted otherwise. Pricing info: From result3 under "Why Choose Us" section says non-regulated at $175/hr and IRS-regulated at $225/hr; full estate $1-$2 per sq ft. Also mention online photo valuations free? Wait noâ€”looking back at result6 under FAQs question5 says costs vary by type but offers competitive pricing with quotes upon request. Other possible entries: Precious Metals Refinery does jewelry appraisals in Tucson (result4). But query is about Phoenixâ€”maybe they have other locations? The site says "Our jewelry appraisal services are currently not available in our California stores." So maybe only Tucson AZ locations mentioned there; unclear if serving Phoenix too. Probably exclude unless there's explicit mention. Asian Antique Appraisers (Baker Appraisers?) from result7â€”their website asianantiqueappraiser.com doesn't specify location beyond specializing in Asian antiques; contact page would need to check if they serve Phoenix or not since no address given here except maybe via email/phone consultation? Ellen Amirkhan from ARCS (result5) seems based in Dallas TX so likely not relevant for Phoenix directory. HomeAdvisor cost info isn't directly related to antique appraising but more real estate/home appraisal so skip that part except perhaps note that home vs personal property/appraisal differs? Now compiling each entry: For Prestige Estate Services: They're located in Phoenix according to [1]. Team members include Edward Kitson et al., plus Erika Holycross who specializes fine art/antiques/collectibles with ISA certification/USPAP compliance [3]. Alicia Weaver as president overseeing nationwide team [8]. Specialties would include antiques across various categories like furniture art etc., certifications ISA/USPAP compliant IRS-qualified [2][6][8]. Service areas: Nationwide including multiple states but specifically mention servingPhoenix AZ[1][8]. Years in business: Since 2010 when Alicia founded it[8]. Contact info same across all entries under Prestige? Wait individual profiles may differ: E.g., Erika Holycross has her own page[3] with phone same as general number(844 ITEM VAL), email specific to her or general? In her profile contact details say Phone: same number EmailAppraisal@... So likely all go through main line/department rather than individual contacts unless specified otherwise. So listing each individual within Prestige might be redundant since it's one company with multiple staff members specializing differently? But user wants list as many antique appraiseRS as possible so even if part of same company should list them separately if possible? Looking back at source[1], Meet Our Team lists Edward Kitson Elizabeth Lovett Stephanie Calman â€”but no further details on them individually except names whereas other sources detail others like Erika H and Alicia W who have more information available elsewhere like their bios/certifications/specialties etc.. Hmm tricky because some team members donâ€™t have detailed bios while others do.E.g.,Edward Kitsonâ€™s name appears only once without any specifics.So perhaps focus on those with detailed profiles:Erika H,Alicia W,and then group others under the main company entry mentioning additional staff without specifics due lack data availabilityï¼Ÿ Alternatively present the company first then list key personnel within it along their specialties/certs/etc.. But user wants each entry to be an 'appraiser' possibly implying separate businesses.But given that these are employees of PESï¼Œmaybe treat PES as one entity listing its key personnel insideï¼Ÿ Alternatively split into separate entries per named professional where sufficient data exists.For example,Erika Holycross has her own bio pageï¼ˆsource3ï¼‰so she can be listed individually.Alicia Weaver also has own profileï¼ˆsource8ï¼‰as President.Prestige Estates overall can be another entry covering other team membersï¼ŸBut this could lead duplication.I think better approach is present ([Source](https://prestigeestateservices.com/locations/phoenix-arizona/) [^6]).
